H0.text: Protons and electrons are the same number in all atoms of a given element.

H1.text: Neutrons and electrons are the same number in all the atoms of a given element.

H2.text: All atoms of a given element have the same number of cells and electrons.

H3.text: Neutrons and protons are the same number for all atoms of a given element.

A4.text: In an ordinary uncharged atom, the atomic number is also equal to the number of electrons.

A5.text: Atoms with the same atomic number but different neutron numbers, and hence different mass numbers, are known as isotopes.
